entry.title: Holiday Snowtacular 2022
entry.summary: Weâ€™ve got ourselves a real holiday treat! Join host Alex Trost from the Frontend Horse community for the Holiday Snowtacular 2022 this Friday, December 16. Thereâ€™s a lineup of 12 awesome speakers â€” including Chris Coyier, Cassidy Williams, Kevin â€¦ Holiday Snowtacular 2022 originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: Linux Shells for Beginners â€“ Bash, Zsh, and Fish Explained
entry.summary: When you open up your terminal, chances are that it uses Bash as its UNIX shell environment. But other "shell" environments exist. There are other environments such as the C Shell, Korn Shell, Z Shell, and even the Fish Shell. All of these different shell environments have their own pros

entry.title: Understanding Privacy: Protect Your Users, Protect Yourself
entry.summary: All of us want to create inclusive, safe, and privacy-aware digital experiences, but where to begin? Our brand new Smashing Book, â€œUnderstanding Privacy,â€ written by Heather Burns, can help you lay the ground for future developers, designers, and project managers to build a better web for tomorrow. [Jump to the details](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/12/understanding-privacy-new-smashing-book/#about-the-book) or [get the book right away](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/printed-books/understanding-privacy/).

entry.title: Accessible Front-End Patterns For Responsive Tables (Part 2)
entry.summary: There is no universal solution for making every kind of table responsive and usable on smaller screens, so we have to rely on various patterns, which Adrian explains in this two-part series.

entry.title: A Few Times Container Size Queries Would Have Helped Me Out
entry.summary: CSS Container Queries are still gaining traction and many of us are getting our hands wet with them, even if itâ€™s for little experiments or whatnot. Theyâ€™ve got great, but not quite full, browser support â€” enough to justify using â€¦ A Few Times Container Size Queries Would Have Helped Me Out originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
